docs.title: Main Page
docs.text:
This is my personal website with notes.

A lot of cool things I setup for learning japanese or other things in other hobbys or when I find cool resources, usually I forget how to do it properly in a while and all the tweaks I made for myself. This website helps me to archive these things and keep them accessible from any device.

Structure is very chaotic and not polished since website is focused on me. If you find something useful for you as well thats very nice and if you want to polish something or correct, improvements are welcome.

All Hail to The Fish

docs.title: Download
docs.text: Get the latest version from Official Anki Download Page.

docs.title: Preferences
docs.text: Go to Tools→Preferences and set all settings as below. Configure Answer Keys to your liking.

docs.title: Syncing Tab
docs.text: Log into your AnkiWeb Account on Syncing page.

docs.title: Other Tabs
docs.text: Set remaining tabs to whatever.

docs.title: Presets
docs.text:
Click on your deck's settings knob → options and setup the default preset for Japanese decks:

  • 10 new cards a day
  • All available reviews
  • New cards with 5min → 15min steps
  • Failed cards with 10min → 1hour steps
  • After 5 failed reviews card is suspended

docs.title: Note Type
docs.text:
My favourite Anki Note Type for Japanese is jp-mining-note. You can find installation gudie here. After that you can read through Reference to understand card structure and Note Type features.

Example

You can download my sample card to see how I usually use this template. The only thing I changed is the field order to make card creation a bit easier.

One of my favourite things about this note is that you can hover over kanji and see in which your other card this kanji was used. Very helpful to make connections between cards and increase retantion rate.

Warning

Card will create a warning if you have multiple cards for the same word. I personally ignore them and don't mind having multiple cards in multiple contexts for complicated words.

docs.title: Add-ons
docs.text: Highly recommended to install listed below essential add-ons. Navigate to Tools→Add-ons, push Get Add-ons..., and type the code according to addon page. Then some of these add-ons will have Config option or separate settings button in Tools tab which you can tweak up to your liking. I leave everything at default, except Review Heatmap.

docs.title: Essential add-ons
docs.text:
• AnkiConnect (2055492159): essential add-on to connect anki to external apps such as yomitan dictionaries
  • AJT Japanese for JP Mining Note (200813220): furigana and pitch accent generator for jp-mining-note Note Type
  • Review Heatmap (1771074083): review activity visualization GitHub style

docs.title: Optional add-ons
docs.text:
• VOICEVOX Japanese Text To Speech Audio Generator (366960193): AI TTS generator
  • Kanji Grid Kuuube (1610304449): learnt kanji visualization
  • FSRS Helper (759844606): additional useful functionality for anki scheduler
  • Advanced Browser (874215009): more features to anki browser

docs.title: Settings
docs.text: Navigato to Tools→Add-ons→Config to edit add-on's json config or go to respective gui context menu, usually located in Tools tab.

docs.title: AnkiConnect
docs.text:
Add links for asbplayer and ttsu e-book reader by modifying the json like this:

{
    "apiKey": null,
    "apiLogPath": null,
    "ignoreOriginList": [],
    "webBindAddress": "127.0.0.1",
    "webBindPort": 8765,
    "webCorsOriginList": [
        "http://localhost",
        "https://killergerbah.github.io",
        "https://reader.ttsu.app"
    ]
}

docs.title: Review Heatmap
docs.text: I recommend to put heatmap Tools→Review Heatmap Options... in Continuous Timeline for better looks.

docs.title: Finish
docs.text:
Now your Anki Setup should be completed, congratulations!

As the next setup, you can go to setting up Yomitan for quick look ups and easy card creation.
